meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of Mozambique.
meanings.sent1: In Mozambique, you can buy many things with meticais.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for meticais at the bank.
meanings.sent3: The piggy bank was full of meticais, making it heavy to carry.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes lit up when she saw the pile of meticais on the table.
meanings.sent5: The sound of meticais jingling in his pocket was music to his ears.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the currency meticai.
meanings.sent1: She counted the meticais in her wallet to see if she had enough for the trip.
meanings.sent2: The street vendors accepted both meticai and meticais as payment.
meanings.sent3: The children played with fake meticais during their pretend store game.
meanings.sent4: The room was filled with the colorful paper of meticais pinned to the walls.
meanings.sent5: The market was bustling with people exchanging meticais for goods.
